Reviews.Title: “Great room and stylish hotel let down by surly staff”
Reviews.Author: Joshua P
Reviews.Content: Great first impressions - hotel is under a year old and very stylish. The pool is tiny (under 6 ft wide at one end - I did a width without moving!) but it's nice to have along with a steam room / sauna / gym. Also the location is great - you're right next to a lovely park and you just take the 200 bus which runs regularly and into town. The journey takes 15-20 mins and is easier than the tube. So overall we'd recommend the place. Two gripes though: one, the restaurant staff were rude when we arrived for dinner at the pre-arranged time; and two, they tried to charge us EUR 18 for a pot of coffee on room service! That just seems like extortion and leaves a nasty taste. If you do go, make sure you head to the Cafe Am Neuen See a few minutes away in the park. It's an awesome outdoor beergarden - our favourite place in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend getaway or a business meeting”
Reviews.Author: InnaSapo
Reviews.Content: Very interesting hotel, they have a sea theme all around it, e.g. dolphin's singing in the elevator - which is quite an interesting touch and life&travel quotes by famous people on the walls! :) I used this hotel for a meeting, meeting space is very well equiped, our room was with natural lighting and located in the quiet corridor so you can be sure nothing will disturb you during your meeting. F&B service is immaculate, a waiter called Nicholas who assisted us with meeting requirements/lunch was quick and nice to deal with. Hotel Spa is on a very high level, it is not a huge area, but enough for about 6-8 people. The main thing is that everything is very clean and it is a pleasure to use their Spa at the end of a long meeting. Great hotel location, just 10 min walk from a shopping area and 30 min drive from Tegel Airport. Rooms are really quiet, clean and very stylish. Room service food is extremely superb, applause to their evening Chef! The only minus is the wi-fi, it is quite slow if you required to access web portals, but is ok for the emails. Will definitely recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Belmores
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our 11yr old son for an Easter break. Hotel is suituated in the Embassy quarter and is reasonably new. Rooms are bright, fresh and clean. Good strong shower and plenty of shampoo, shower gel etc so you don't need to take your own. Whilst no subway nearby, the hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the station at the zoo but this is made pointless by the bus stop right outside the door. The 200 bus takes you into Postdamer Platz and onto Alexanderplatz, or to the terminus at the zoo if going the other direction. If arriving into Schonefeld airport take the train to Bundesplatz and catch the U9 to the Zoo. The 200 bus will take you to the hotel door. No wi-fi in the rooms but they do offer free cabled internet in the room, with wi-fi available in the hotel lobby. They also offer a pc with printer in the lobby for free use - ideal for online check-in etc. Used the fitness centre. Pool is small and a bit cold - not really suited for swiming or children who want to play. Small sauna and steam room are adequate. No changing rooms at the pool so get changed in your room. Towels are available at the pool but can be in short supply later in the day. Small gym with various weights, bikes and running machines adjacent to the pool. Didn't use the restaurant for breakfast preferring to eat on the go. Plenty of choices at all of the main tourist points - Postdamer Platz probably gives the best selection. Overall a good hotel with friendly, helpfull staff. Ideal location for exploring with Tiergarten park only a 5 minute walk away for those who like to get into the fresh air. Would happily recommend to others visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “More to do to be considered a true Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M0nika81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pestana recently during ITB in Berlin and although the hotel itself is well laid out, the rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, as a business hotel there are some crucial things lacking. While internet is offered in the room, free of charge for a very basic connection, no WiFi at all (free or chargeable) is available in room. This makes it quite frustrating for most people who are using smart phones. WiFi is offer in the lobby, but this is the only place. If you want to use internet that is not really slow in the room the first charge is $19 per day, which seems excessive. If these types of things were fixed I would certainly consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for seeing BErlin”
Reviews.Author: matkincc
Reviews.Content: Whilst I stayed at this hotel on business I was able to arrive within 15 minutes of the airport and be able to walk into the centre of Berlin. The staff were very helpful at reception and in the restaurant but breakfast was disappointing and the coffee was weak! Plenty of restaurants and cafes covering all cuisines and it was very safe to walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a beautiful area of West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ARKTIKMANN
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a beautiful are of West Berlin. Modern and clean. Bonus was the pool, steam room and sauna. The cafe and restaurant has a modern open feel with stylish finishings and interior. A+ hotel, you won't be dissapointed. Bus is located just outside and ease to get to Mitte or other parts of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: belagori
Reviews.Content: A very stylish hotel at a very good price. Everything worked perfectly, it was immaculate and the service was friendly and cheery. Breakfast was excellent. I would look to stay at Pestana hotels elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bringing some Algarve light to Berlin winter”
Reviews.Author: landscapemanleeds
Reviews.Content: We usually prefer hotels run by locals, German in Germany, Italian in Italy, etc., so opting for Berlin's Portuguese-owned Pestana was done out of curiosity - but based on several good experiences we've had at the pousadas they run 'back home'. (Oh, and the price was good, too.) Pleased to say, it was a really good 6-night stay. The bedrooms are just about OK size-wise (the generally clever design has ended up with a bit of a squeeze near the fitted wardrobe), but against that the bathroom space is generous. So well-lit is the bathroom that you might need sunglasses. A blue light over the bath gives the water a touch of the warm sea, and if you flip a venetian blind you can look from your bath through the bedroom and out of the window. (Brrr!) Great shower, by the way. Overall, your private quarters have been made to feel as light and bright as the Algarve, all white and blue. Good bed, extra pillows if you ask, stylish chairs. The hotel actually says 'style' everywhere - good furnishings, and quirky touches like a projected seascape of swimming fish on the floor of reception. The lift lobbies on the various floors all have a wall of poetic quotations translated in several languages, where a key theme seems to be the sea, and death - death at sea, even. A bit odd, perhaps, certainly in Berlin, but at least it gets the guests talking. Breakfasts were good, although the capacity of the restaurant seems pretty finely calculated: we never waited for a table, but there were usually only one or two spare. We tried the food once or twice at other times, and reckon the Portuguese dishes are excellent whereas the German or international are just OK. The hotel staff were super - friendly and helpful, without exception. When we were there, quite a few parents or grandparents were staying and taking the kids to the zoo, which is right nearby. As a location, the Pestana is not at all bad. Excellent for walks in the Tiergarten, Berlin's main park, which is just a short street away; dependent otherwise on the number 200 bus, stopping just by the hotel, which has a great route from Zoo Station right through Potsdamer Platz to Unter den Linden and East Berlin, but was (in our experience) a bit erratic. We waited quite a few times longer than the scheduled 10 minutes, and gave up once and just walked. If you don't take the bus, be prepared for a 15-minute walk (at least) to the nearest underground, a bit less perhaps to the shops. We would certainly go back to the Pestana, although to be honest it'd be even nicer to visit them in Portugal again!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for price.”
Reviews.Author: chanteusecrystal
Reviews.Content: My husband I and stayed here for two nights, and I must say it was a very comfortable and quiet hotel. The check-in went smoothly, the personnel was very helpful and welcoming, and the rooms, charming, modern and simple in design. The outside of the hotel doesn't look like much, however the inside is very very clean and modern. My hubby took advantage of the small pool in the lower level, but unfortunately it was extremely cold, so he didn't hang out there too long. The breakfast was very good, complete with various breads, lunch meats, salmon, cheese, yogurts, etc. It was surprisingly good (I'm used to 3-4 star chain hotels with mediocre all-inclusive breakfasts'). The location may not have been the best, however, there are metro stops in the neighborhood as well as various boutiques and big name shops (such as Zara/H&M). There's also a Christmas market down the street, for the time being. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It's great for a short stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice design hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmwAlsace
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel ( it opened end of august this year ) is very nice and very quiet 10 minutes away from the Kurfürstendamm and very close to the bus N° 100 which allows you to see for 2,6 € the major attractions in Berlin. The staff is very nice, very helpfull and gives you usefull advices to visit the city - as an example the BAUHAUS Museum which is also 10 minutes away from the hotel. Rooms are very comfortable - however a bit narrow - and the fitness center very relaxing. Breakfast is more than sufficient. I'll stay there again for my next journey in the city

Reviews.Title: “overcharged, sterile, un-hospitable hotel, bad value”
Reviews.Author: flpcrnls
Reviews.Content: A cold and sterile environment ! What a poor architects fantasy ! Useless gadgets have to camouflage the lack of service offered ( no wifi in the room, small and cheap towels, small boring white room, very mediocre bed, no coffee/tea set , staff have no interest etc etc. One feels like stepping into a jail ward when using the elevator : one needs one's room key to be able to operate. No nearby connection to any tube or railway, and far away from where any action is. You can not be further away from home... Due to circumstances I had to stay an extra night, but for this they wanted to charge an extra cost of about 50 euro's on top of the 159 euro's, because the hotel was filling up (!?!?! ), good for the figures , but how customer unfriendly. I checked out immediately to find myself a room at a similar price range with everything one can wish for, near Potsdammerplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent especially for youths!”
Reviews.Author: KateP_Europe
Reviews.Content: Very good overall impressions on Pestana Tiergarden. I liked especially: 1/ very nice service - people working there are not as 'stiff' as in some other 4* hotels, which is an additional attitude. That's why I would recommend it especially for young people. 2/ very nice location, near the big park and close to shopping area. I did not really like as modern style as it is decorated - it seemed too 'sterile' for me but cleanliness on a very high level, so it did not bother me much. Food of a good quality. Bed (or maybe pillow) comfort could be better. Overall experience very positive, also strengthen by wishes and small souvenir from the hotel on day of my birthday ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in nice area!”
Reviews.Author: MRPCam
Reviews.Content: Brand new really nice and confortable hotel! Location: The hotel is on the Tiergarten area close to the embassies. Although the area is really nice and quiet, there aren't many restaurants or coffeeshops on a walking distance. Transportation however is not a problem, both the 100 and the 200 buses stop by the hotel on a very regular schedule and they take you to the busier parts of the city in no time. The Zoo is within walking distance, so is the Philarmonie. Rooms: Rooms are functional and confortable. Well decorated, great design and color palet,mostly white and blue. Bed was confortable, although conforter was a lit bit too warm for October. Bathroom has a tub with a really big shower. Closet is a bit small for a bigger stay. Big TV flat screen. Free wireless is slow, but you can buy a quicker connection or go downstairs to the lobby computer. Design and decoration: Since Pestana is a portuguese hotel chain, the "sea theme" for the decoration was a really good choice! Details like portuguese poems written in the walls and wave sounds on the elevators were really appreciated. Breakfast buffet: nice bread selection, great croissants, 3 kinds of juice, tea, coffee, milk, 2 kinds of cereal, boiled or stirred eggs, sausages, bacon, tomato, cucumber, salmon, big selection of cheese and hams, 4 kinds of jam, nutella and honey...everything was very well prepared and fresh! Highly recommended! Staff: since it's a new hotel I guess they are still a bit inexperient...the girls in the lobby were not very imaginative when giving suggestions (I wonder if it's just because they are German...). They were also a bit clueless about a lot of things in the city...I know the hotel is more to the business side but weren't they expecting tourists as well!? One particular episode of lack of manners from the front desk clerk dissapointed me. Apart from that, the cleaning service is excelent, bathroom was spotless! Sauna and pool: didn't get a chance to go, although pictures look really nice! Overall it's a nice hotel, very good price/quality ratio and value for your money, close to transportation! Whether you go on businness or tourism it's a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very "zen" business hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JoachimBruxelles
Reviews.Content: The newly opened Pestana Tiergarten hotel in Berlin was a nice alternative to the classical business hotels in the city. I had business in the hotel itself and in the neighborhood and made a very good overall experience. Nice and well designed rooms (all very cool and functional) with all the amenities you need. The free WiFi access is a bit slow and really only good for checking mail and googling things, but you can have a fast one for a moderate budget. The meeting rooms are spacious and have windows!!! Great breakfast and in particular a very relaxing position in the mid of Berlin Tiergarten. The walk to the Brandenburger Tor and the historic center is just 30 minutes through that beautiful park.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel with brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: l3sl3y
Reviews.Content: We were doing the classic "four countries in eight days" nonesense, and because of the e-coli outbreak in Hamburg - Berlin won the German beauty contest. What a find - it was our first visit to Berlin - hence our first stay at the Pestana - a chain unknown to me. The hotel was excellent - it had only opened a few week previously - but seemed not to have any of the blips often associated with new openings. The greeting was great - we'd booked a space in the carpark - but to unloads - managed to park outside. The receptionist told us in faultless English that parking on street was cheaper than in the carpark - but was still covered by their surveillance system. Music to the ears of a Yorkshirewoman. But what of the hotel? Superb. Really high grade fittings, a wonderful bathroom - and a state of the art coffee maker which I JUST ABOUT mastered before we left. The breakfast was genuinely the best I have ever had with everything on offer - Continental, American English - you name it - it was there - from gravalax, to about a dozen types of bread, etc etc. We ate in the hotel one evening - and again - neither the service or the quality of the food didn't disappoint. The location is wonderful - 5 minutes from Tierpark/Garten - 10 minutes from the Zoo and on the No1 bus route which cheaply takes you to all the tourist sites. The only watch point - the spa/pool are is eccentric - communal showers and when we were there - an exhibitionist happy to bear all irrespective of the audience! If ever go back to Berlin - this is the hotel I'd book as I don't know how it could be equalled for the price. Did I mention the price? In June - 300 euros for three nights including breakfast. 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new hotel. Cosy and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: odabums
Reviews.Content: New hotel with big, cosy rooms. It is placed in a quiet street but at the same time very close to Ku'damm and you can take the 200-bus right in front of the hotel. Breakfast was nice and we had dinner once at the hotel and it was fantastic. The food was not expensive but the drinks were a bit pricey. Being a bit picky, my only "complaint" would be the free but very slow internet connection. We will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy - no problems”
Reviews.Author: IFCUK
Reviews.Content: We had a very cheap offer at £62 per room B&B and at that price it was good value. The place is fairly new, smart and clean, but the underlying quality of some fittings may not stand the test of time. Location seems to be out on a limb but the two bus services - 100 and 200, go to the main places and are very convenient. The breakfast was good - if a bit busy. We did not try the pool and gym but it looked very smart. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Reading the other reviews, they seem to sum it up fairly. No hesitation to return. There is a five star Berlin Intercontinental Hotel a few hundred metres down the road and if you go in there, you may notice the difference in opulance., but I guess the cost would reflect that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Afforable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: lascarReading
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May 2011, shortly after the hotel opened. We got an opening offer of £62 bed and breakfast, so this influences my perception that it was luxury at a very affordable price. Even at the rack rate of 99 euros it would have been a reasonable deal. As a new 4 star hotel the bedroom and bathroom were as expected. Bright, clean and functional in a minimal fashion. The hotel is located on the south side Tiergarten, equidistant from the Brandenburg Gate and the Schoneburg gay district which was perfect for combining sight seeing and gay bars, if that's what you want from a weekend away. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Continental/English/German or a combination of all three and it is available until noon on Saturday and Sunday to suit early birds or late night clubbers. There's a small gym, swimming pool, sauna and relaxation area in the basement. My only surprise and slight disappointment was that wireless internet in the bedrooms is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, slick hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveled-Gourmet
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel is offering a great promo rate at the moment and I urge you all to give it a try. Lovely bright well designed rooms, v.good bathrooms, v.goo in room techi stuff. Note that internet is FREE in the lobby, but expensive in the room! Great Buffet Breakfast, and reasonable bar prices eg a 2dl glass of Grau Burgunder(excellent by the way) costs €4.50. Pool & Gim are free, but parking is chargeable @€15 and MUST be booked in advance €70 B&B for 2 with an automatic upgrade to superior-a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: AndyWilliamson22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights earlier in July, and the location was perfect. Not only was it close to the main shopping area and the Tiergarten/Zoo, but the 200 bus stopped just outside the hotel and the 100 bus just around the corner. Using those 2 buses, we got almost everywhere we wanted to go in Berlin. This made our trip, which was fascinating, so easy. There weren't many (if any) places to grab food within walking distance, but this is being picky. You could also tell that the hotel was very new, and the staff didn't seem to know Berlin very well. Nevertheless, they tried to help and there was also free internet access in the lobby which was great (though no wi-fi in the rooms which was a bit frustrating). The breakfast was decent too, with quite a variety. I'd say it seemed more of a hotel for conferences than for holiday makers but, as we were essentially using it as a base, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Dejligt hotel, men ikke specielt service-minded personale”
Reviews.Author: Bentofte
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel, quiet and clean. It's a new hotel, opened in May 2011, and it have some problems with their many technical systems.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: lnd_uk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel situated near the Zoologischer Garten railway/underground/bus station. (The bus from Tegel airport goes straight there). It is opposite a huge park which is great for a stroll. The rooms are stylish and the staff are fantastic. Flat screen TVs, wifi, fluffy bathrobes and slippers are all avaiable. It is very reasonably priced and the buffet breakfast covers all tastes...and in vast quantities! There is even a fantastic selection of speciality teas and coffees at no extra cost. The small indoor swimming pool, sauna and steam room are all very relaxing after a hard day's sightseeing.The bar, with a lovely outside siiting area as well, is a great place to enjoy an evening drink. All in all, a great hotel in a great location. (Berlin has an excellent rain/bus/underground network. Buy a 3 or 5 day pass which covers the entire network and even includes the journey from the airport. Also very bike friendly) Can't wait to go back for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: PulseTurbo
Reviews.Content: We've broken the review down into sections - I hope it's useful! Room We stayed in Room 402, and it was fantastic! The room was light and spacious, with fantastic views from the huge window. Our room had a clear view of the ‘TV Tower’. I should note however that the window wasn’t clean (two large smudge marks on the window). TV channels provided are mainly German (as you’d expect), with the only English-speaking channels being BBC World and another American channel. The rooms are very clean (aside from the window already mentioned), and we were very happy. I personally found the beds to be quite uncomfortable; however that may be because we use a Tempur mattress at home, so that view may be slightly unfair! Shampoo and shower gel, sewing kit, cotton wool buds and some other toiletries are provided in the room, as well as a built-in hairdryer. The air conditioning in the room is fantastic – no problems at all. Very cold when you want it to be, and similarly very hot when you want it to be. A safe is provided in the room, and it’s easily big enough for a laptop. For an indication, we were able to fit the following in there (all at once): 11” Laptop, wallet, keys, PSP, MP3 player, camera, passports and tickets – with plenty of room to spare. It’s a digital 4-digit code safe, and very easy to use. The room also has an iPod dock, which I used to listen to music from my iPhone. It also charges it, so leave your charger at home with confidence! (iPhone 3GS) The room was very quiet, and we heard nothing from our neighbours! Internet Access Wireless internet is available for free in the lobby, based on a one-hour token system which the staff are happy to provide multiple codes for when you arrive. The lobby also has a PC if you don’t bring a computer with you, which is rarely being used, so you’ll often be able to get on. A standard ethernet connection is provided in the room (also free), but make sure your laptop has an ethernet port! Unfortunately my MacBook Air doesn’t have one, so we were stuck using the internet in the lobby! Gym The gym is brilliant, but (as to be expected) there isn’t a great range for anyone into weightlifting - The fixed-weight dumbbells go up to 10kg. Also in the gym is a treadmill, a cycling machine, a cross trainer, and benches for weight lifting. The gym opens from 7am until 10pm each day, and was never busy during our stay. ‘Wellness Area’ (Spa) The ‘Wellness Area’ has the following: Pool, Loungers, Steam Room & Sauna. The pool is very nice, although don’t expect to be able to swim lengths with another person in the pool. The pool is a slightly awkward shape, which makes the problem worse. The loungers are nice, though in busy periods you won’t get one! (Which we often found) The steam room and sauna are really nice, but as with the rest of the ‘Wellness Area’, they’re often busy. The Wellness Area opens from 7am until 10pm each day. Quiet periods are during the early morning and during the middle of the day. It gets very busy later in the morning and from about 6pm onwards. Restaurant (Breakfast) The breakfast included in the room is great, and we really enjoyed it. Included is the following (not an exhaustive list): Sausages, bacon, scrambled egg, hard boiled eggs (though not on purpose!), toast, croissants, apples, various condiments and spreads, cheese, various cold meats, muesli, cornflakes, fresh tomatoes and cucumber, salmon, bread rolls and yoghurts. Drinks on offer: Various teas, coffee, apple juice, orange juice and water. Everything here was fantastic quality, and we looked forward to breakfast every day! Location We found the hotel was ideally located for reaching all of the attractions, and actually found because of this we didn’t even need a travel pass for the week. It is a few metres away from the Tiergarten and not much further from the embassies. A short walk takes you into the favourites. You can easily walk from the Zoologischer Garten S-Bahn station, which we did. A simple ABC single (3 eur) will take you to/from the airport. Take the ‘AirportExpress’ – It’s much faster! Staff We found the staff generally OK, though don’t expect much from the staff in the restaurant. We found them quite rude, and making guests wait whilst they took priority walking through – One even asked for our room number (having asked for no-one else’s) quite rudely, then asked again five minutes later; with a bad attitude. Staff on reception were better, though certainly no charmers. No real issues there. Cleaning staff were very friendly, and we had no problems with them at all (although one day they didn’t empty the bin – worth noting, as it was full!) Parking We didn't park at the hotel, but it's 15 eur per night. Overall, an excellent hotel, and one we would stay at again. If it were not for some small downfalls, it would definitely have scored a 5. On this occasion, it scores a 4. Thank you Pestana Berlin for a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “All that you can ask for!”
Reviews.Author: JTereso
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just arrived fromm our 4 day trip to berlin, where we stayed at the Pestana Tiergarten Hotel for some lovelly 3 nights! We actually didn't spend that much time at the hotel, aside from sleeping, but we had a great time there. Expect good food at a fair price, specially the lunch menus, and some portuguese specialties. The breakfast is superb (expect for the eggs, a little dry) with plenty of choice. The rooms are fully equipped and beautifully designed with a huge bed and spacious bathroom. The hotel has a spa and gym. The hotel is located in a very quiet zone, next to the tiergarten and a lot of embassy buildings. Despite that, the 200 bus line has stops right in front of the hotel, making it very easy to get everywhere you want to go, as the 200 bus is one of the 2 lines that cross the city through the center. At a fair price the pestana is definatelly your option!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Pestana Berlin”
Reviews.Author: norkmb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a nice stay at Pestana Berlin Hotel in the beginning of June. When we booked the room we couldn't find a review of this new hotel, so we were a bit skeptical in advance. The design of the hotel is a bit futuristic, and a little cheesy, but everything is new, so not much to complain about. The service was okay, and the receptionists were helpful and spoke understandable English. The room was nice. Modern and spacious, but we didn't get exactly what we booked, as another reviewer also write here on Trip advisor. We booked our room through hotels.com, and the description said that the rooms have a balcony, a city-view and free wireless internet. I read the review about this here the day before departure, and called hotels.com to get this clearified. They called Pestana and who said that not all rooms have balcony, even though this is what stood on hotels.com when we ordered. They said we could request a room with balcony, which we did, but did not get. Maybe the hotel is not to blame, and only hotels.com, but it was a bit dissapointing. The view from the room was to the backyard of the nearby embassy. There was a wi-fi to connect to, but it was free only for 24 hours. Worked fine. The beds in the room was just okay, and two single beds were placed next to each other, but not attached in any way, so they glided apart all the time. When booking the room it said the bathroom had a bathtub, which it did not. The shower was large and comfortable, so we didn't mind. Positive: A small speaker with iPod/iPhone connection next to the bed. Charged my iPhone 4 and played music. Very nice. Large TV with movie rentals. A bit expensive(13 euro for a movie) though. The location of the hotel was very good for our part. The 200 bus route, which goes from the Zoo to Alexanderplatz stops almost right outside the hotel, and can get you anywhere. I think the nearest stop is named Corneliusstrasse. The restaurant was a little above average. The breakfast was nice. We rented a couple of bikes from the hotel for 8 euro per bike for a whole day. This was maybe our best experience in Berlin. The city is very good for cyclists, even though there is a lot of construction work downtown. A cycling trip thrugh the large park of Tiergarten was terrific in the afternoon! Since I couldn't find a photo of the front side of the hotel online, I took a couple of photos myself so people can see what it looks like.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and Good”
Reviews.Author: PencilPrincess
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for it's proximity to the Embassies. I was surprised to find absolutely no reviews of this hotel online when I booked it, but then I found out it was very new. No reviews, new hotel, awesome location = exciting unknown. When we walked up to the Pestana we knew we were in the clear. The hotel is lovely as well as lovingly placed. Customer service is as I, personally, like it: straightforward, very professional and no frills. Just good, straight service. Breakfast buffet was lovely. 4 star level indeed. Just to mention a few of the offerings: Lax, Nurenberger sausages, bio yoghurt in glass jars with kiwis, chives, a selection of Granini juices, self service espresso machine and a silver carafe of coffee at every table. Presentation was clean and lovely. I found myself looking forward to breakfast. A sweet location in the Embassy district. The lap pool and sauna were also great benefits for us in the morning before we started our day. Despite all the great restaurants in Berlin, we looked forward to sampling the food here after a long day about the town. The restaurant provided nice service and good food. We especially liked the Portugese Fish Soup. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “You don’t get what you book!”
Reviews.Author: morregard
Reviews.Content: For a five night stay in Berlin, we booked this hotel trough hotels.com. One of the reasons to choose the newly opened Pestana Berlin Tiergarten out of the 1000 hotels in Berlin, was the despriction on hotels.com, which among other things promised a room with balcony, city view and free wifi. Once we arrived at the hotel, we got a room with no balcony, no city view and no wifi. We complained of course, but there wasn’t much to do, as the 6th floor with the balconies and the city views apparently wasn’t open yet. Moreover the reservation manager claimed that the room type, which we had booked, didn’t have balcony, city view and free wifi. We showed her the booking, where it - nevertheless - was clearly stated. But, that was a mistake, she just said. We asked for compensation and got a free lunch to a value of 10 euro – not much when we had (pre)payed around 90 euro per night to stay there. Apart from this, the hotel itself was quite nice; brand new and with pretty big rooms. Especially the bed and the bath room was a nice experience. Also the breakfast was above average with a wide selection of food and drinks. Taken into consideration that the hotel is situated in the middle of Berlin, the location is quite bad - unless you are attending a meeting or a conference at one of the many embassies around. The area is really quiet and boring, and the hotel’s pretty far from the nearest U- or S-bahn. All in all, you’ll be happier choosing one of the many other good hotels in Berlin - and hopefully then you’ll also get a hotel, where you get what you booked.
